{"comments": {"id": 3017, "count": 556, "talk_id": 1118}, "threadId": 3017, "requested_language_english_name": "English", "current_talk": "1118", "description": "Backed by stunning illustrations, David Christian narrates a complete history of the universe, from the Big Bang to the Internet, in a riveting 18 minutes. This is "Big History": an enlightening, wide-angle look at complexity, life and humanity, set against our slim share of the cosmic timeline.", "event": "TED2011", "language": "en", "language_swap": false, "name": "David Christian: The history of our world in 18 minutes", "slug": "david_christian_big_history", "series_slug": null, "speakers": [{"id": "915", "slug": "david_christian", "is_published": true, "firstname": "David", "lastname": "Christian", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Historian", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/5696122880f90626b594b1c5dc363b59a2a2dc39_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "", "whotheyare": "David Christian teaches an ambitious world history course that tells the tale of the entire universe -- from the Big Bang 13 billion years ago to present day.", "whylisten": "

David Christian is by training a historian of Russia and the Soviet Union, but since the 1980s he has become interested in world history on very large scales. He has written on the social and material history of the 19th-century Russian peasantry, in particular on aspects of diet and the role of alcohol. In 1989, he began teaching courses on "Big History," surveying the past on the largest possible scales, including those of biology and astronomy.

Christian is a member of the Australian Academy of the Humanities. Over the next few years he will also be working with the support of Bill Gates to create an online course in "Big History" for high school students.

Watch the Big History series on H2 >>

Most of the second half explores human history; the final chapter looks to the future.", "note": "Cynthia Stokes Brown The New Press, 2008", "link_url": "http://www.amazon.com/Big-History-From-Bang-Present/dp/1595584145/ref=as_li_tf_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&creativeASIN=0520271440&linkCode=as2&tag=teco06-20", "position": null, "is_pdf": false, "eyebrow": null}, {"label": "READ_Book", "headline": "Epic of Evolution: Seven Ages of the Cosmos", "blurb": "Chaisson is one of the pioneers of big history, having taught such courses from an astronomer's point of view since the early 1980s. This is his telling of the big history story, showing how increasing complexity is sustained by increasing energy flows. ", "note": "Eric Chaisson Columbia University Press, 2007", "link_url": "http://www.amazon.com/Epic-Evolution-Seven-Ages-Cosmos/dp/0231135610/ref=as_li_tf_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&creativeASIN=0520271440&linkCode=as2&tag=teco06-20", "position": null, "is_pdf": false, "eyebrow": null}, {"label": "READ_Book", "headline": "Big History and the Future of Humanity", "blurb": "Spier has taught big history in Amsterdam since the mid-1990s. He has a background in biochemistry as well as in anthropology, so has the perfect training for thinking about the field. In this book, he develops the ideas of Eric Chaisson and explores the important notion of 'Goldilocks conditions,' showing how complexity appears only in very special places in the universe, where the conditions were 'just right.'", "note": "Fred Spier Wiley-Blackwell, 2011", "link_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/5696122880f90626b594b1c5dc363b59a2a2dc39_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "", "whotheyare": "David Christian teaches an ambitious world history course that tells the tale of the entire universe -- from the Big Bang 13 billion years ago to present day.", "whylisten": "

David Christian is by training a historian of Russia and the Soviet Union, but since the 1980s he has become interested in world history on very large scales. He has written on the social and material history of the 19th-century Russian peasantry, in particular on aspects of diet and the role of alcohol. In 1989, he began teaching courses on "Big History," surveying the past on the largest possible scales, including those of biology and astronomy.

Christian is a member of the Australian Academy of the Humanities. Over the next few years he will also be working with the support of Bill Gates to create an online course in "Big History" for high school students.

Watch the Big History series on H2 >>

title: The history of our world in 18 minutes
